summary: Dorne I am proud to announce that you can now get this beautiful highly detailled map of Dorne on my website. ...
caption:
Dorne

I am proud to announce that you can now get this beautiful highly detailled map of Dorne on my website.

https://klaradox.de/en/galerie/dorne/

It shows the geography and the sigils of the main houses on it - every place that has ever been mentioned in any of the ASOIAF series, including “Fire and Blood”.

If you purchase it, you’ll also get the link to the full resolution of the upcoming poster of Dorne (work in progress), which will include the mythology and history of this part of Westeros and also a family tree of the Martells.

summary: Gatiss’s ‘tour de force’ as George III
title: Gatiss’s ‘tour de force’ as George III
body:
Sherlock star Mark Gatiss gives a “tour de force” performance as George III in a new production of Alan Bennett’s play about the king, according to reviews.

The Madness of George III at Nottingham Playhouse is “a perfect star vehicle” for Gatiss, according to The Guardian’s critic Kate Maltby.

The Telegraph’s Dominic Cavendish agrees, saying Gatiss had come “into his own as a leading theatre actor”.

Bennett’s 1991 play shows King George battling a mystery mental illness.

Nigel Hawthorne won an Olivier Award for playing the troubled monarch in the original production and went on to reprise his role in the 1994 film.

Cavendish gave the play five stars and saluted the way the Gatiss “keeps drawing out more from himself, coiled entrails of pain, confusion and fear, while somehow retaining his lovability”.

According to The Stage, the League of Gentlemen and Game of Thrones actor “rises to the challenge” of following in Hawthorne’s footsteps and “turns out to be very good casting”.

Critic Natasha Tripney wrote: “Gatiss’s performance is very physical. He makes the most of his height, stalking the stage, splay-toed, as he conveys the king’s rapid decline.”

Gatiss also drew high praise from Nottingham culture website LeftLion, whose reviewer Jared Wilson said Gatiss was “excellent, engaging and energetic throughout”.

Debra Gillett and Adrian Scarborough also appear in Adam Penford’s revival, which will be screened live in cinemas on 20 November.

George III reigned from 1760 to 1820, during which time Britain lost its American colonies in America’s war of independence.

The king makes a cameo appearance in musical hit Hamilton, in which he is seen berating the revolting colonists for “making him mad”.

As well as his acting roles, Gatiss has written for Sherlock and Doctor Who.

Follow us on Facebook, on Twitter @BBCNewsEnts, or on Instagram at bbcnewsents. If you have a story suggestion email entertainment.news@bbc.co.uk.

Related Topics

  • Theatre
  • Nottingham

Read more: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-46129054

The post Gatiss’s ‘tour de force’ as George III appeared first on Viral TV News.



from WordPress http://www.viraltvnews.com/game_of_thrones/gatisss-tour-de-force-as-george-iii/

blog.name: peaceisadirtyword
blog.title: Go on, Boneless
blog.description:
I might break a bone, but I can never break a promise. II Salma, 20, I love writing, reading, watching series and Alex Høgh.

Masterlist

title: 1k Writing Challenge!💜
body:
Hello loves! As I said yesterday, I’m doing a writing challenge to celebrate the 1000 followers! Some of you already told me they’d like to participate and I’m really excited! I cannot wait to read your work!♥️

Now is when no one participates lol joking I hope at least some of you want to😅

So, I didn’t exactly know how this goes so I asked a friend for help and she helped me to write the prompts, they are very simple, we wanted to make like 30 but as we divided them in angst, smut and fluff we ended up with 60(?) so at least you can choose😂 

Rules: though they are more indications I think

-The deadline is the 15th January 2019.

-You can write for whoever you want to; my blog is dedicated to Vikings but I also enjoy GOT, The Last Kingdom, Outlander, Harry Potter… You can write for actors, characters… Your choice! Also you can write an au if you want to.

-Of course you can write male x male or female x female or whatever you want to.

-Feel free to write angst, fluff, smut, the three at the same time…

-You can choose as many prompts as you want.

-Please if your fic includes mature content (smut, violence…) warn it!

-There’s no limit of words!

-Tag me so I can see it! (if tumblr is being rude dm it to me💕)

-If you want to participate send me an ask with the character you want to write for and the prompts you want to use!

-If you don’t feel like writing anything but have an idea, you can send it to me and I will try to write it!

-If you want to write something but are too shy to post it on your blog or whatever, you can send it to me and I’ll post it for you! giving you credits, of course. This is obviously if you want to post something anonymously.

-Write whenever and whatever you feel comfortable to! You have time and I’m sure you’ll do an amazing job. We’re gonna love it♥️

Prompts 

I got carried away I’m so sorry

Angst 

1. You have to stop pushing me away

2. I can’t keep doing this

3. It’s over

4. Please look at me

5. Stop crying please

6. Don’t say that about yourself

7. You never seemed to notice me 

8. Am I not enough?

9. Leave 

10. I don’t want to see you ever again

11. I hate you

12. If you leave, don’t bother coming back

13. I should never have trusted you

14. How could you betray me?

15. I don’t think I’m in love with you anymore

16. You deserve better than me

17. This is too much for me

18. You lied to me

19. Obviously, you don’t trust me

20. Goodbye

Fluff

1. I love you

2. How can you be so handsome/beautiful?

3. Stop being insecure, you are the most astonishing human being I’ve ever seen.

4. Kiss me

5. I’d like to kiss you now, if you let me

6. This is the part when it starts raining and I confess I can’t live without you, right?

7. Freyja would be jealous. (this is a vikings or the last kingdom one sorry lol I couldn’t help it)

8. For you, I’d kill every single person in the world.

9. Can’t we just cuddle?

10. You’re the most comfortable pillow I’ve ever tried

11. I’m sorry, I wasn’t listening, I was distracted by how perfect your lips are

12. Please, stay with me

13. Promise me you won’t leave

Rules: though they are more indications I think

-The deadline is the 15th January 2019.

-You can write for whoever you want to; my blog is dedicated to Vikings but I also enjoy GOT, The Last Kingdom, Outlander, Harry Potter… You can write for actors, characters… Your choice! Also you can write an au if you want to.

-Of course you can write male x male or female x female or whatever you want to.

-Feel free to write angst, fluff, smut, the three at the same time…

-You can choose as many prompts as you want.

-Please if your fic includes mature content (smut, violence…) warn it!

-There’s no limit of words!

-Tag me so I can see it! (if tumblr is being rude dm it to me💕)

-If you want to participate send me an ask with the character you want to write for and the prompts you want to use!

-If you don’t feel like writing anything but have an idea, you can send it to me and I will try to write it!

-If you want to write something but are too shy to post it on your blog or whatever, you can send it to me and I’ll post it for you! giving you credits, of course. This is obviously if you want to post something anonymously.

-Write whenever and whatever you feel comfortable to! You have time and I’m sure you’ll do an amazing job. We’re gonna love it♥️

summary: What aspects of Sophie's portrayal of Sansa you like and don't like?
question: What aspects of Sophie's portrayal of Sansa you like and don't like?
answer: Honestly her portrayal has been hindered by D&D who don’t value Sansa’s femininity or softness or skills. I think she did her best with what she was given and even managed to make early seasons Sansa interesting and charming regardless of what her antis say. Her strength is that she’s able to show vulnerability quite well. She really shined in season 6 and 7.
